result.title: Report on collecting schemes Europe
result.description: Comprehensive study of the different policies and European rates applicable to music used in audio branding or as 'background music' charged by rights collecting societies, both for copyright and phonographic rights. This is part one of a policy analysis with stakeholders from the professional user group of music providers focussing on collecting societies in EU. A structured overview of existing schemes is delivered and used for the development of alternative schemes to be evaluated, promoted and implemented in T7.4.

result.title: Project Website
result.description: Set-up of a growing public ABC DJ web-site that constitutes the central point for all project information. Aside from the public part a restricted (protected) section is reserved for consortium-internal communication, maintaining the partner's knowledge database (background / foreground) managed by WP1 as well as communication with the EC and project reviewers. Public pages will over time in any case present: a project portrait, partners' profiles, scientific achievements and public deliverables, visible and audible examples, prototype depictions, a blog, connections with other social media channels, a press section and an event calendar.

result.title: Music providers landscape Europe
result.description: Production of a comprehensive overview over the landscape of European music creators and their respective multipliers in an audio branding and instore music context. This includes an investigation of music management procedures as well as audio file formats and qualities in use. An opening investigation of the same issues for the Americas and Asia is carried out.

result.title: NEWTON website
result.description: The project website will provide detailed information about the project objectives and activities. It will consist of two parts: a public part and a private part: The public part will be opened to the general readership and it will be regularly updated with the latest activities within the project. It will also include access to the public deliverables of NEWTON project. The private part of the website will be only accessible to the members of the consortium and will be protected by password. This private part will have access to all NEWTON deliverables and milestones, contact information to facilitate the communication among consortium partners as well as access to the information sharing tools employed during the project. The website will be created and maintained by the Project Coordinator, with the support from all the partners.
